title: 111_hr5875
content: The Department of Homeland Security's U.S. Customs and Border Protection is appropriated funds for salaries and expenses for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2010. The Department of Homeland Security's U.S. Customs and Border Protection is allocated $356,900,000 for salaries and expenses, with specific allocations for maintaining staffing, hiring officers, and supporting border security programs. The additional funding allocated for border security fencing, infrastructure, and technology is $14,000,000 for tactical communications on the Southwest Border. Another $32,000,000 is designated for air and marine interdiction operations, maintenance, and procurement, specifically for unmanned aircraft systems acquisition and deployment. Additional funding is allocated for construction and facilities management, salaries and expenses for law enforcement activities, and state and local programs for border security and enforcement along the Southwest Border of the United States. The Federal Law Enforcement Training Center is allocated $8.1 million for salaries and expenses to provide basic training for new U.S. Customs and Border Protection Officers and Border Patrol agents. Sec. 101. An additional $201,000,000 is allocated for increased law enforcement activities related to Southwest border enforcement by the Department of Justice. The funds are distributed to various accounts for specific purposes, including Administrative Review and Appeals, Detention Trustee, Legal Activities, United States Marshals Service, and Interagency Law Enforcement. Sec. 102. Rescinds unobligated balances from various law enforcement agencies, including Drug Enforcement Administration and Federal Bureau of Investigation, totaling $235,171,000. Additionally, $15,500,000 from prior year appropriations for Transportation Security Administration is rescinded. Sec. 103. The Department of Defense will cover the costs for deploying the National Guard along the Southwest Border in fiscal years 2010 and 2011. Each amount allocated is considered an emergency requirement to address urgent needs. The Emergency Border Security Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2010 is necessary to meet emergency needs along the Southwest Border. It is considered an emergency requirement under the budget for fiscal year 2010. The Emergency Border Security Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2010 was passed by the House of Representatives on July 28, 2010. Attest: LORRAINE C. MILLER, Clerk.
